oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brady National Photographic Art Gallery (Washington, D.C.), photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Brig. Gen. Orlando M. Poe, officer of the Federal Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This portrait made in the Washington studio of Mathew Brady (1823-1896) by an unknown photographer captures a seated young man facing to his right. He has a mustache and goatee and wears a federal uniform with the one-star insignia of a Brigadier General.

An 1856 graduate of West Point, Orlando Metcalfe Poe served as Chief Engineer of the Army of the Ohio and was responsible for the defenses of Knoxville in November 1863. Soon thereafter, General William T. Sherman made him Chief Engineer of the Military Division of the Mississippi. Sherman relied upon Poe's valuable services for his Atlanta Campaign, the "March to the Sea," and the Carolinas Campaign. Poe was breveted Brigadier General, United States Army, at the war's end.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865; Poe, Orlando M. (1832-1895)
Visualizing the War
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
